go_data.justification: CYP24A1 metabolises 25(OH)D to 24,25-dihydroxy-vitamin D and 1,25(OH)2D to 1,24,25-trihydroxy-vitamin D.
CYP24A1 is involved in the metabolism of vitamin D, which requires oxidoreductase activity.
As a cytochrome P450 enzyme, CYP24A1 is expected to be located in the endoplasmic reticulum.
Mutations in CYP24A1 cause infantile hypercalcemia, indicating a role in calcium ion homeostasis.
